title: Rutgers center Mamadou Doucoure enters transfer portal
body: Rutgers forward Mamadou Doucoure goes up for a shot against Ohio State forward E.J. Liddell during an NCAA college basketball game in Columbus, Ohio, Wednesday, Dec. 23, 2020. junior center Mamadou Doucoure entered his name into the transfer portal on Thursday, he announced on Instagram.“The past four years at RU have been nothing short of spectacular,” he wrote, “I wouldn’t trade it for anything in the world.”The news comes 11 days following Rutgers’ season ended with a loss to Houston in the second round of the 2021 NCAA Tournament.A former four-star recruit out of Our Savior New American in New York, Doucoure started 29 out of the 34 games he played as a true freshman, averaging 2.4 points and 3.2 rebounds in 13.1 minutes per game that season.He took a medical redshirt after six games the following year due to a back injury, and his role diminished from that point on. He played in 31 games over the next two seasons, averaging 5.5 minutes per game in his reserve role. The lone game Doucoure started during that stretch was during the  this February.Despite rarely featuring on the court, he was named a team captain this past season, a sign of the respect he earned from head coach and his teammates.Seniors - (G)Juniors - Ron Harper Jr. (F), Montez Mathis (G), Caleb McConnell (G/F)Sophomores - Paul Mulcahy (G), Daniel Lobach (F)Freshmen - Dean Reiber (F), Oskar Palmquist (F), Mawot Mag (F), Cliff Omoruyi (F), Jaden Jones (G)Note to readers: if you purchase something through one of our affiliate links we may earn a commission.
